oneOf.title: Unrecoverable (location known, bet can't get it back)

coordinatesVerbatim.title: Verbatim coordinates from label or other original source

oneOf.title: KKJ astekoord. = Finnish KKJ decimal (NOT PREFERRED)
Decimal degrees with unknown system (NOT PREFERRED)
Degrees minutes seconds, with unknown system (NOT PREF.)

localityVerbatim.title: Verbatim locality from label or other original source

oneOf.title: 2a Southern boreal, Southwestern Finland and Southern Ostrobothnia
GW (cultivated, from seeds of wild source)
Z (propagule from wild source in cultivation)
E - spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TE - alien, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TVE - alien, resident, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TOVE - alien, old, resident (archaeotype), cultivated origin
TNVE - alien, new, resident, cultivated origin
TNSE - alien, new, ephemeral, cultivated origin
H - short distance escape from cultivation (inside a garden or similar)

detVerbatim.title: Det verbatim from the label or other original source

oneOf.title: Unrecoverable (location known, bet can't get it back)

owner.ui:help: Team or organisation that owns the record and can edit it.

collectionID.ui:help: The collection which this specimen belongs to

primaryDataLocation.ui:help: Location of the primary data if not Kotka.

status.ui:help: Empty value means same as "ok" - that there is not anything special about the status of the specimen.

condition.ui:help: Notes on the defects of the specimen (missing parts or such). Empty value means same as "good" or "hyvä" - that there is nothing special to mention about the condition.

originalSpecimenID.ui:help: Original catalogue number or other  original identifier of the specimen. E.g. H9000000

voucherSpecimenID.ui:help: Identifier of the herbarium voucher specimen or information about it if the identifier is unknown.

plannedLocation.ui:help: Garden area where this accession is planned to be located.

leg.ui:help: Name of the collector(s), in format 'Lastname, Firstname; Lastname Firstname'

legVerbatim.ui:help: Leg just as it appears in the label or other original source, no interpretation, errors and all.

dateVerbatim.ui:help: Date just as it appears on the label or other original source, no interpretation, errors and all

substrate.ui:help: Type of substrate or name of substrate species.

coordinatesVerbatim.ui:help: Coordinates, possible coordinate system and error radius word-to-word as they appear on the label or other original source, errors and all.

latitude.ui:help: Latitude. For southern latitudes, use negative value.

longitude.ui:help: Longitude. For western longitudes, use negative value.

coordinateSystem.ui:help: More information about the coordinate systems: https://wiki.helsinki.fi/display/digit/Entering+specimen+data

coordinateSource.ui:help: Use for NEW SPECIMENS: Where the coordinates have been acquired

georeferenceSource.ui:help: Use for OLD SPECIMENS: What source was used to get coordinates based on locality names

coordinateRadius.ui:help: Maximum error of coordinates in meters

alt.ui:help: Altitude form sea level in meters, single value or range (E.g. 90, or 80-100). No GPS altitude here.

depth.ui:help: Depth in meters, single value or range (E.g. 0.9, or 0.8-1.0)

localityVerbatim.ui:help: Locality word-to-word as it appears on the label or other original source, errors and all

country.ui:help: Country name in English, or 2-letter country code, or name from label

higherGeography.ui:help: If country is not known or not applicable, for example continent, ocean or large island

biologicalProvince.ui:help: Formal abbreviation. For Finnish eliömaakunnat, use Finnish abbreviation.

administrativeProvince.ui:help: Regions, rayons, provinces and other administrative areas. Separate multiple names with commas, from generic to specific. (E.g. Etelä-Suomen lääni, Uusimaa)

municipality.ui:help: Municipality, commune, town, city or civil parish

locality.ui:help: Official name of the locality in basic form. Separate multiple names with commas, from generic to specific. No informal description here.

localityID.ui:help: An unique identifier or code for the locality, if the locality has one (e.g. from SAPO-ontology).

localityDescription.ui:help: Informal description of the exact locality, e.g. '5 km NE of city X, under stone bridge'

habitatClassification.ui:help: Formal habitat name or abbreviation. If several, separate with semicolons (E.g. 'OMT; OMaT').

associatedObservationTaxa.ui:help: Write associated observation taxa names here, separated by a semicolon (;). E.g.: "Betula pendula; Betula pubescens; Poaceae". These will form their own units of the type observation.

associatedSpecimenTaxa.ui:help: Write associated specimen taxa names here, separated by a semicolon (;). E.g.: "Betula pendula; Betula pubescens; Poaceae". These will form their own units of the type Preserved specimen.

collectingEventName.ui:help: Name of an expedition or such.

notes.ui:help: Additional information to the data in each section.

numberOfSampledIndividuals.ui:help: For garden accessions/seed bank, number of individuals from which seeds were collected

percentageGivingSeeds.ui:help: For garden accessions/seed bank, what proportion of the population sampled was giving seeds

samplingAreaSizeInSquareMeters.ui:help: For garden accessions/seed bank, estimated size of the area sampled, in square meters

primarySpecimen.ui:help: Can be used to highlight one unit as primary specimen/observation if there are many in one document. Only one unit per document can be marked as primary.

recordBasis.ui:help: Type of record, most commonly preserved specimen for museum specimens and observation for associated observations ("seuralaislajihavainto").

recordParts.ui:help: What parts of the record are / have been in storage.

provenance.ui:help: Origin or source of the garden accession

plantStatusCode.ui:help: Status code for the plant (wild, alien etc.)

lifeStage.ui:help: Life stage of the specimen. If multiple present, select the one which was present at the time of collecting. Use Life stage description field for extra information.

lifeStageDescription.ui:help: Free-text notes or addtional information about the life stage. If multiple values present, describe them here.

causeOfDeath.ui:help: Cause of death, if not intentionally trapped on sampled

sexNotes.ui:help: E.g. how sex was determined, by whom and when.

age.ui:help: Estimated or known age in calendar years, years, days or other relevant unit.

ageNotes.ui:help: E.g. how age was determined, by whom and when.

count.ui:help: Numeric or other description on the amount of individuals (or sprouts, fruiting bodies or such) in the specimen. Sexes and juveniles can be specified like so: 1m2f3j (=1 male, 2 females, 3 juveniles)

populationAbundance.ui:help: Abundance of the taxon in the field

DBH.ui:help: Diameter at breast height, in centimeters

decayStage.ui:help: Estimation of decay stage (lahoaste in Finnish) on the scale of 1 to 5 and/or description

chemistry.ui:help: Results of chemical reaction tests etc.

microscopy.ui:help: Microscopic features and measurements, if not recorded separately into measurement fields.

macroscopy.ui:help: Macroscopic features and measurements, if not recorded separately into measurement fields.

preparations.ui:help: Preparations/preparates made from the specimen, if not recorded as separate Preparations/samples in the designated section

ring.ui:help: Bird or bat ring number, code, colour code or such

notes.ui:help: Additional information to the data in each section.

measurement.ui:help: For measurements taken from the preparation/sample, use the measurement field in the preparation/sample section. For measurements taken from the specimen, use the measurements field on unit level.

infraRank.ui:help: Taxonomic level of the epithet below species level

infraEpithet.ui:help: Taxon name for the epithet below species level

infraAuthor.ui:help: Author for the taxon below species level/infra epithet

taxonVerbatim.ui:help: Taxon name in original format (e.g. from the label), errors and all

genusQualifier.ui:help: Additional qualifier or specifier at genus level (e.g. aff., cf.)

speciesQualifier.ui:help: Additional qualifier at species level (e.g. aff., cf., sp. n., coll.)

det.ui:help: Name of the identifier (person) preferably in format "lastname, firstname"

detDate.ui:help: Date or year when the identification was done, preferably in format "d.m.Y" or "Y"

taxonID.ui:help: ID for the taxon if has some other than an MX code

detVerbatim.ui:help: Name of the identifier and date of identification in original format (e.g. from the label), errors and all

sec.ui:help: Publication reference for the taxon concept, that was used in identification

identificationNotes.ui:help: Additional information on the identification, basis or such

preferredIdentification.ui:help: This can be used to select one of the identifications as 'recommended', which is the used as default when displaying information about the specimen.

typeStatus.ui:help: Is this holotype, paratype, syntype etc...

typif.ui:help: Name of the person who chose the type, preferably in the format "Lastname, firstname"

typifDate.ui:help: Date when the specimen was chosen as a type

typeVerification.ui:help: Verification whether this really is a type?

typeBasionymePubl.ui:help: Publication reference for original description or basionyme

typeSeriesID.ui:help: ID for the type series, if part of one

material.ui:help: Preparation/sample material. Choose preparation/sample type first.

individualsInPreparation.ui:help: For example a jar that contains multiple fish individuals can be recorded as one specimen and one preparation. Can also be used for DNA samples (was DNA extracted from single or multiple individuals?).

preservation.ui:help: Preservation methods and materials of the preparation/sample. It is possible to choose several

preparedBy.ui:help: Name of the person who prepared the preparation/sample, preferably in the format 'lastname, firstname'

preparationDate.ui:help: Date when the preparation/sample was prepared.

preparationProcess.ui:help: Processes used in the preparation. It is possible to choose several.

preparationMaterials.ui:help: Materials (chemicals, kits etc.) used in the preparation process. It is possible to choose several.

preparationProcessNotes.ui:help: Additional information about the preparation process.

measurement.ui:help: For measurements taken from the preparation/sample, use the measurement field in the preparation/sample section. For measurements taken from the specimen, use the measurements field on unit level.

qualityCheckMethod.ui:help: Method or instrument used for quality measurements

qualityCheckDate.ui:help: Date of the latest quality check measurements

quality.ui:help: DNA sample quality on a three step scale. The quality is defined by quality check measurements

qualityNotes.ui:help: Additional information about the DNA sample quality

DNAExtractionInstrument.ui:help: Name of the instrument or device used for DNA extraction

event.ui:help: Diary-style information about what has been done to the preparation/sample

sampleLocation.ui:help: Location of the preparation/sample so that museum personnel can find it. E.g. room, freezer, shelf number etc.

genbank.ui:help: Genbank ID for the preparation/sample. If no other preparation/sample information is entered, use the Genbank field on the document level

bold.ui:help: BOLD ID (usually BOLD "Sample ID") for the preparation/sample. If no other preparation/sample information is entered, use the BOLD field on the document level

status.ui:help: Status of the preparation/sample. For specimen level status use the status field in the basic information section. Empty value means same as "ok" - that there is nothing special about the status of the sample.

condition.ui:help: Notes on the defects of the preparation/sample (missing parts or such). For specimen level status use the condition field in the basic information section (document level). Empty value means same as "good" or "hyvä" - that the sample is in fine condition.

datasetID.ui:help: Tag for the preparation/sample. For specimen level tags, use the tag field in the basic information section (document level).

publication.ui:help: Publication references or doi's that refer to this preparations/sample. For publications referring to the specimen, use publications field in the Other section (document level).

additionalIDs.ui:help: Other identifiers this preparation/sample has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'MZHtissue:123'. You can enter the type and colon and then click 'generate' to fetch the next free number for that prefix type.

collectionID.ui:help: The collection which this preparation/sample belongs to, if different from the collection of the specimen.

labelsVerbatim.ui:help: All text from labels word-for-word, including spelling errors. Separate each label on its own row, starting from topmost label.

cladBookID.ui:help: Clad book id number or such

cladSpecimenID.ui:help: Clad specimen id: usually color description and a number

cladVerbatim.ui:help: Verbatim specimen data from clad book

verificationStatus.ui:help: Information about the quality of the specimen data. Possible to select several.

notes.ui:help: Additional information to the data in each section.

documentLocation.ui:help: Location of the specimen so that museum personnel can find it. E.g. taxon under which it is stored (if not clear from the identification), or shelf number

DNASampleLocation.ui:help: Leave empty if no sample taken, or if the sample is recorded separately

publicityRestrictions.ui:help: PUBLIC: all data can be published; PROTECTED: exact locality is hidden (100*100km square); PRIVATE: most of the data is hidden. Empty value means same as public.

legID.ui:help: Collecting number (field identifier, keruunumero) for the specimen

genbank.ui:help: Genbank identifier. You can include additonal comment by separating them with colon, e.g. "AY123456:comments here"

bold.ui:help: BOLD identifier, usually BOLD Sample ID. You can include additonal comment by separating them with colon, e.g. "AY123456:comments here"

relationship.ui:help: Relationship to another taxon OR specimen. Choose relationship type as prefix and give taxon name or specimen identifier thereafter, e.g. "parasite: Parasiticus specius" OR "host:http://tun.fi/JAA.123"

additionalIDs.ui:help: Other identifiers this specimen has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'mzhtypes:123' (old MAZ-type number)

dataSource.ui:help: Where the data about this specimen or observation is from, in addition to labels. Eg. reference to a publication, field notes or an expedition.

publication.ui:help: Publication references or doi's that refer to this specimen

separatedFrom.ui:help: ID of the specimen from which this has been separated

separatedTo.ui:help: ID's of those new specimens that have been separated from this specimen

duplicatesIn.ui:help: Description where duplicates (specimens of the same individual) are located or have been sent to and by which ID's.

acquiredFrom.ui:help: From who/where the specimen was acquired (if not recorded as a transaction)

acquiredFromOrganization.ui:help: Organization where the accession was acquired from. If the organization is not on the list, add it first.

acquisitionDate.ui:help: Date (d.m.yyyy) or year (yyyy) on which the specimen was acquired to the collection. Empty means an old specimen acquired on an unknown date.

event.ui:help: Free-text diary-style information about what has been done to the specimen and when.

exsiccatum.ui:help: Name of the exsiccatum this specimen belongs to and possible exsiccatum number.

preservation.ui:help: Main method of preservation. If parts of the specimen are preserved in different ways, you can choose several methods.

URL.ui:help: URL where more information is available about the specimen

language.ui:help: Language the data is (mainly) written in, if applicable.

editNotes.ui:help: Reason for this edit or notes about it.

transcriberNotes.ui:help: Additional information regarding the data entry or transcription process, e.g. unclarities, explanations for interpretations,

privateNotes.ui:help: Notes shown within the system for users signed in but not shown publicly anywhere. Use only for notes that absolutely need to be hidden from public view.

unreliableFields.ui:help: List of those fields that contain unreliable data. The list is created automatically.

namespaceID.ui:help: Namespace of the existing ID, if the specimen has one already. E.g. for "GZ.101" it is "GZ".

objectID.ui:help: ID of the specimen, if it has one already. E.g. for "GZ.101" it is "101".

crossCheck.message: If you set Object ID, you have to set namespace ID also.

format_0.message: The input can contain only letters, numbers and dashes.

crossCheck.message: If you set Namespace ID, you have to set Object ID also.

datetime.tooEarly: Date is too early. Earliest possible is %{date}
Date is too early. Earliest possible is %{date}
